newsitem.title: BOTSWANA: China to rehabilitate Botswana Railways main track.
newsitem.headline: China to rehabilitate Botswana Railways main track.

text.p: China is to rehabilitate 214 km of Botswana Railways' (BR) mainline track at a cost of 76 million pula, BR marketing manager Kagiso Mogobe said on Monday.
This latest project follows the rehabilitation of 391 km of BR track by the Chinese last year.
The money will be loaned to Botswana by the Chinese government, repayable over 10 years after a five year grace period at an interest rate of 4 percent per annum.
BR general manager Amrithalingam Ramji headed a delegation to Beijing last week to sign the deal.
Of the 76 million pula, 70 percent must be spent in China.
An agreement was signed to purchase rails from China and to pay for five Chinese technicians who will oversee the three-year project.
The remainder of the budget will be used for local and regional purchases of sleepers, ballast and fastenings.
